turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about National Bureau of Investigation (Finland).
turn.1: What is the function of National Bureau of Investigation?
turn.2: NBI hosts the national centres of Interpol, Europol and Schengen cooperation as well as develops new forensic investigation methods, equipment and material for the police force.
turn.3: What is the budget of the bureau?
turn.4: In the fiscal year 2016, the National Bureau of Investigation's budget was approximately 72.5 million euros.
turn.5: Where is the headquarters of the bureau?
turn.6: NBI headquarters has been located in the Tikkurila district of Vantaa within the Capital region area since 1994. The Bureau also hosts field offices in Tampere, Turku, Mariehamn, Joensuu, Oulu and Rovaniemi.
turn.7: Is there a museum in the bureau?
turn.8: The headquarters houses the Crime Museum, which holds about 6 000 pieces of criminal history, including tools used in crimes and punishment as well as documents and photos with most of the collections from the 20th century.
turn.9: How many employees are in the bureau?
turn.10: As of January 2014, NBI has been divided into three divisions in addition to administrative services: The Criminal Investigation Division is further divided into sections on organised crime, homicide, financial crime and information gathering—and the Criminal Intelligence Division contains a separate section on international affairs as well as a Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU).
turn.11: What percentage of women are employed in the bureau?
turn.12: NBI had 696 staff, of whom 39% were women, at the end of 2016.
